definition: affected by myopia : of, relating to, or exhibiting myopia : nearsighted
examples: It is likely the FDA will initially approve the procedure for severely myopic patients, though it is unclear what range of impaired vision will be included.
In some eyes, the lens does not become flat enough to bring far objects in focus, although it focuses near objects well; people with such eyes are said to be myopic (nearsighted).

definition: lacking in foresight or discernment : narrow in perspective and without concern for broader implications
examples: Higher learning can offer individuals and societies a depth and breadth of vision absent from the inevitably myopic present.
But only a myopic angler would fail to recognize the alarming signals in those unusual conditions.
Like most who mutilate Chopin, he was musically myopic, fawning over each note instead of seeking the longer shape of a phrase, its arc and context, where the real beauty lay.
